channel.title: methodology on ryan jennings
channel.description: Recent content in methodology on ryan jennings

item.title: Rubber Ducking
item.description: Yes, rubber duck debugging is really funny. The wiki, a dedicated site or coding horror explain it pretty well. It is a fantastic methodology because there is no other human to try and take advantage of your stupidity - implicitly (unconsciously) or explicitly (capitalism). Like media and technology which this world unconsciously loves and wants to be…. There is a shadow side. To me the story says something about doing programming in the bathtub with a computer.

item.title: Software Methodologies
item.description: At the end of the day, software methodologies are all some form of Development Lifecycle. That is to say, the individuals unit of work, the team’s unit of work and the business, are in one of several stages. Requirements and Planning Analysis and Design Implementation Testing and Verification Deployment and Maintenance That is it. We all know it. The steps may vary but the core ones remain the same.
